folly, noun:

misc.name: pepe store
misc.desc:
by toizi
misc pwn

Description:
My favorite TikTok influencer told me that NFTs are about to blow up again. Since NFTs can otherwise be copied, this project implements access control where only people who previously owned the token can access the jpgs. This ensures only the ones who wear the freshest clothes, eat at the chillest restaurants and hang out with the hottest dudes get access to these rare pepes :^)

misc.name: sponsored
misc.desc:
by SECCON and sandr0

Description:
Thanks for the last minute sponsored challenge excepython from SECCON 2025. Except without exceptions and loops.

misc.name: unbefleckte empfangnis
misc.desc:
by yyyyyyy

Description:
The year is 2025. Nobody wants to work hack anymore.

But don’t worry, hxp 💝 you: Presenting cat flag as a service.

Note: If the server responds to ping, it is almost certainly working as intended. Should you have problems connecting, read setup.sh until you know why!

pwn.name: brainfast
pwn.desc:
by rfab and aengelke

Description:
My brainfuck interpreter was too slow, so I added a JIT compiler. Alpine Linux helps to keep things lightwight.

pwn.name: cassandra von hxp
pwn.desc:
by katharina and hlt

Description:
🤡 dev for 🤡 software

Use the flag for orakel-von-hxp as the decryption key for the download:

echo -n 'hxp{the_flag}' | openssl aes-256-cbc -pbkdf2 -iter 100000 -salt -d -pass stdin -in cassandra-von-hxp.tar.xz.enc -out cassandra-von-hxp.tar.xz

Hint: The flag is continously input on UART1.

rev.name: chekhov
rev.desc:
by hlt

Description:
Look, it’s Chekhov’s license checker!

This binary requires at least glibc 2.35 and Linux 5.18. Some of the checks may be flaky in edge cases, but I haven’t observed this happening in practice. Unfortunately, if that happens for you, that is entirely your problem.
